title: Critical Zero-Day Vulnerability Found in Windows Kernel
body: Microsoft has disclosed a zero-day vulnerability (CVE-2025-1234) in the Windows Kernel that allows privilege escalation. A patch is expected to be released in the next security update.

title: Reddit User Shares Favorite Mechanical Keyboard of 2025
body: A popular Reddit post on r/mechanicalkeyboards ranks the top boards of the year. While lively, the thread is mostly subjective opinions on aesthetics and typing feel.

title: Outage Hits AWS US-East-1 Region, Affecting Major Services
body: Amazon Web Services is experiencing a partial outage in its US-East-1 region, disrupting services including EC2, S3, and Lambda. The incident is under investigation.

title: Linux 6.8 Released with New Filesystem Features
body: Linus Torvalds has announced the release of Linux 6.8. The update includes improvements to Btrfs performance and memory management, but no urgent security updates.

title: Google Chrome Patches Critical V8 Vulnerability Exploited in the Wild
body: Google has pushed an emergency Chrome update to address a V8 JavaScript engine vulnerability being actively exploited. Users are advised to update immediately.
